@shoyer The name of partial_sum has been suggested to change to reduce_slice_sum, see #9063 (comment)
The tf.repeat and tf.reduce_slice_sum are gradients of each other if we ignore the difference of the API. But the current API of tf.repeat and tf.reduce_slice_sum makes it a little bit tricky to use directly:

  • In order to use tf.reduce_slice_sum as gradient of tf.repeat, there must be another op to compute the indices that tf.reduce_slice_sum takes.
  • In order to use tf.repeat as gradient of tf.reduce_slice_sum, there must be another op to reorder and merge some gradients, and compute the repeats argument that tf.repeat takes.

body:
@shoyer The name of `partial_sum` has been suggested to change to `reduce_slice_sum`, see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9063#discussion_r113259298
The `tf.repeat` and `tf.reduce_slice_sum` are gradients of each other if we ignore the difference of the API. But the current API of `tf.repeat` and `tf.reduce_slice_sum` makes it a little bit tricky to use directly:

- In order to use `tf.reduce_slice_sum` as gradient of `tf.repeat`, there must be another op to compute the `indices` that `tf.reduce_slice_sum` takes.
- In order to use `tf.repeat` as gradient of `tf.reduce_slice_sum`, there must be another op to reorder and merge some gradients, and compute the `repeats` argument that `tf.repeat` takes.
